title: Blanking the Screen
content:
## What is Screen Blanking?

Blanking the screen temporarily hides the projected image by displaying a black screen. The projector lamp stays on and audio continues (if enabled).

**Not the same as:**
- Power Off - Turns projector completely off
- Freeze - Shows static snapshot of last frame

## How to Blank/Unblank

**Steps:**
1. Click the **Blank Screen** button (yellow)
2. The projected image immediately blanks to black
3. The button changes to **Unblank Screen**
4. Click again to restore the image

**What happens:**
- The projector immediately displays a black screen
- The projector lamp stays on (not the same as power off)
- Audio continues if enabled
- History Panel shows "Screen Blanked → Success ✓"

## When to Use Blank Screen

**Common scenarios:**
- Hide sensitive content temporarily during a presentation
- Pause between presentation sections
- Keep audience focused during discussions
- Prevent distractions during Q&A
- Switch between presenters

**Why use blank instead of power off?**
- Much faster (instant vs. 30-90 second warm-up)
- No projector wear from power cycling
- No cooling delay when resuming

## Blank vs. Freeze

**Blank Screen:**
- Shows black screen
- Use to hide content completely
- Instant on/off

**Freeze Display:**
- Shows static snapshot
- Use to pause while explaining
- Your screen continues updating

> **Tip:** Blank Screen is faster than turning the projector off and back on. Use it for brief pauses.
